author: Derek Call
title: First Look: New Balance 1400v5
text:
Privacy Policy | About Us 
For cushioning, there’s a single piece of RevLite foam underneath the foot that helps deliver a really responsive ride. It’s pretty soft in the heels and can get you on your toes quick. 
Underneath, you get a lot of good traction from rubber on the outsole. There’s a new configuration with different types of edges that will give you traction on a lot of different surfaces, so when you’re going fast, you don’t have to worry about slipping. 
RELATED: 2017 Spring Shoe Guide 
Another new feature on the 1400v5 is the engineered mesh upper. It has a sleek look, there’s not a lot of seams or overlays, and you get some structure as well. 
The New Balance 1400v5 retails for $100 and it will be available in April 2017. We will have a more detailed review in a future article on RunnersWorld.com.
